New Records: The Warriors set a new record with 36-point advantage from behind the arc, sinking 21 3-pointers compared to just nine for the Pelicans.
Key Match Events: Lindy Waters III scored 17 points in his first 17 minutes of action and his third 3-pointer gave the Dubs their first lead since the game's opening minutes (69-67)
Buddy Hield caught fire in the fourth quarter, scoring 19 points on 6-for-8 shooting and a perfect 4-for-4 from deep
Pre-Game Insights: The Warriors were without Stephen Curry, Andrew Wiggins and De'Anthony Melton
Coach Steve Kerr emphasized the importance of depth and perimeter shooting
Post-Match Reflections: Buddy Hield expressed his excitement about the team's comeback victory
Lindy Waters III considered the Warriors the 'best possible fit' for his playstyle
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors acquired Lindy Waters III from the Oklahoma City Thunder this offseason
Buddy Hield ranks second in the league in made 3-pointers this season (20)
Others: The Warriors will face the New Orleans Pelicans on the second night of a back-to-back at Chase Center on Wednesday (7 p.m. PST)
